verses.text_plain: But it displeased Jonah exceedingly, and he was very angry.
verses.verse_html: 1But it displeased Jonah exceedingly, and he was very angry.

verses.text_plain: And he prayed unto the Lord, and said, I pray thee, O Lord, was not this my saying, when I was yet in my country? Therefore I fled before unto Tarshish: for I knew that thou art a gracious God, and merciful, slow to anger, and of great kindness, and repentest thee of the evil.
verses.verse_html: 2And he prayed unto the Lord, and said, I pray thee, O Lord, was not this my saying, when I was yet in my country? Therefore I fled before unto Tarshish: for I knew that thou art a gracious God, and merciful, slow to anger, and of great kindness, and repentest thee of the evil.

tokens.text: when I was yet in my country

verses.text_plain: Therefore now, O Lord, take, I beseech thee, my life from me; for it is better for me to die than to live.
verses.verse_html: 3Therefore now, O Lord, take, I beseech thee, my life from me; for it is better for me to die than to live.

verses.text_plain: Then said the Lord, Doest thou well to be angry?
verses.verse_html:
4Then said the Lord, Doest thou well to be angry? ▼
▼ Doest…: or, Art thou greatly angry?

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Doest…: or, Art thou greatly angry?
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Doest…: or, Art thou greatly angry?

verses.text_plain: So Jonah went out of the city, and sat on the east side of the city, and there made him a booth, and sat under it in the shadow, till he might see what would become of the city.
verses.verse_html: 5So Jonah went out of the city, and sat on the east side of the city, and there made him a booth, and sat under it in the shadow, till he might see what would become of the city.

tokens.text: what would become of the city

verses.text_plain: And the Lord God prepared a gourd, and made it to come up over Jonah, that it might be a shadow over his head, to deliver him from his grief. So Jonah was exceeding glad of the gourd.
verses.verse_html:
6And the Lord God prepared a gourd, and made it to come up over Jonah, that it might be a shadow over his head, to deliver him from his grief. So Jonah was exceeding glad of the gourd. ▼
▼ gourd: or, palmcrist: Heb. Kikajon
 , ▼
▼ was…: Heb. rejoiced with great joy

tokens.text: that it might be a shadow

footnotes.body_html: ▼ gourd: or, palmcrist: Heb. Kikajon

footnotes.body_text: ▼ was…: Heb. rejoiced with great joy
footnotes.body_html: ▼ was…: Heb. rejoiced with great joy

verses.text_plain: But God prepared a worm when the morning rose the next day, and it smote the gourd that it withered.
verses.verse_html: 7But God prepared a worm when the morning rose the next day, and it smote the gourd that it withered.

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, when the sun did arise, that God prepared a vehement east wind; and the sun beat upon the head of Jonah, that he fainted, and wished in himself to die, and said, It is better for me to die than to live.
verses.verse_html:
8And it came to pass, when the sun did arise, that God prepared a vehement east wind; and the sun beat upon the head of Jonah, that he fainted, and wished in himself to die, and said, It is better for me to die than to live. ▼
▼ vehement: or, silent

tokens.text: And it came to pass, when the sun

verses.text_plain: And God said to Jonah, Doest thou well to be angry for the gourd? And he said, I do well to be angry, even unto death.
verses.verse_html:
9And God said to Jonah, Doest thou well to be angry for the gourd? And he said, I do well to be angry, even unto death. ▼
▼ Doest…: or, Art thou greatly angry?
 , ▼
▼ I do well…: or, I am greatly angry

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Doest…: or, Art thou greatly angry?
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Doest…: or, Art thou greatly angry?

footnotes.body_text: ▼ I do well…: or, I am greatly angry
footnotes.body_html: ▼ I do well…: or, I am greatly angry

verses.text_plain: Then said the Lord, Thou hast had pity on the gourd, for the which thou hast not laboured, neither madest it grow; which came up in a night, and perished in a night:
verses.verse_html:
10Then said the Lord, Thou hast had pity on the gourd, for the which thou hast not laboured, neither madest it grow; which came up in a night, and perished in a night: ▼
▼ had pity: or, spared
 , ▼
▼ came…: Heb. was the son of the night

tokens.text: for the which thou hast not laboured
which came up in a night

footnotes.body_html: ▼ had pity: or, spared

footnotes.body_text: ▼ came…: Heb. was the son of the night
footnotes.body_html: ▼ came…: Heb. was the son of the night

verses.text_plain: And should not I spare Nineveh, that great city, wherein are more than sixscore thousand persons that cannot discern between their right hand and their left hand; and also much cattle?
verses.verse_html: 11And should not I spare Nineveh, that great city, wherein are more than sixscore thousand persons that cannot discern between their right hand and their left hand; and also much cattle?
